results.title: Coventry cathedral
results.creator_credit: Dudley Shaw Ashton, British Council and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Coventry’s medieval cathedral was destroyed by air raids in 1940, but a new cathedral is being built from the design by Basil Spence. The architects model is shown and a realistic impression of the beautiful building is obtained. Spence gives an explanation of his work and he makes the point that all cathedrals were modern in their time. The work of artists and craftsmen specialising in stained glass, tapestry and stone are also shown. Commentary by Basil Spence.

results.title: Coventry and Ottobeuren join hands
results.creator_credit: F I B Dr W Lutje
results.brief_description: In 1964 the Benedictine monastery of Ottobeuren in Bavaria, celebrated its 12th centenary. Taking part in the celebrations was Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent, a manifestation of the cultural ties between Great Britain and Germany.

results.title: Courtesy for beginners
results.brief_description: Produced to stimulate an interest in good manners among young children. Students from a junior grade class practice such simple acts of good manners as being considerate to a guest, making correct introductions, and using such expressions as “please”, “thank you”, and “excuse me”.

results.title: Courtesy
results.creator_credit: Richard Kilburn, John Shearman and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Thousands of passengers pass through London’s main stations every day, and during the rush hour platforms are a sea of faces. How do railway men or passengers retain a sense of courtesy in such a situation? How does the Station Master deal with difficult incidents? These are some of the questions asked in this film, and both staff and travellers put forward opinions. A film more likely to provoke discussions than to provide an answer.

results.title: The County clerk
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper and Central Office of Information for Scottish Home Department
results.brief_description: The manifold duties of a Scottish County Clerk. As the administrative centre has to deal, directly or indirectly, with schools, health, housing, libraries and social services of every kind, and with the civil defence, fire services and police requirements of industry.

results.title: Country school teacher
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of a typical country school teacher in a one teacher school near Lismore, NSW. The teacher is shown teaching his varied class, leading them in games, and taking a useful place in the rural community. The film points out that isolation is one the main difficulties for a rural teacher, showing a conference attended by many such teachers to discuss their problems. Photography by George Lowe. Music by the East Lismore school choir.

results.title: The Country Roads Board gazette No. 10
results.brief_description: Progress report on work of the Country Roads Board; rebuilding the Warrigal Road and the Nepean Highway intersection; new road bridge across the Maribyrnong River at Footscray; construction of a new Air Force air strip; digging storm water drains in the metropolitan areas; maintenance and building of country roads and bridges.
